@graph.d3f:definition: Proxy-based web server access mediation focuses on the regulation of web server access through intermediary proxy servers.
@graph.d3f:kb-article:
## How it works

Proxy-based Web Server Access Mediation involves controlling access to web servers via proxy servers, which act as intermediaries between users and web resources. This approach can enhance security by anonymizing user requests, filtering content, and enforcing access policies. Examples include using corporate proxies to access external websites or services.
@graph.rdfs:label: Proxy-based Web Server Access Mediation

@graph.d3f:kb-abstract: Firewalls are devices or programs that control the flow of network traffic between networks or hosts employing differing security postures. This publication provides an overview of several types of firewall technologies and discusses their security capabilities and their relative advantages and disadvantages in detail. It also makes recommendations for establishing firewall policies and for selecting, configuring, testing, deploying, and managing firewall solutions.
@graph.d3f:kb-reference-title: Special Publication 800-41 Revision 1 Guidelines on Firewalls and Firewall Policy
@graph.rdfs:label: Reference - Special Publication 800-41 Revision 1 Guidelines on Firewalls and Firewall Policy
